snippet: It was not clear when 21 Filipino captives, seized on Wednesday in the Golan Heights, might be set free, but the authorities in Manila said they had not been harmed.
abstract: United Nations officials negotiate with Syrian rebels who seized group of 21 United Nations peacekeepers in dispute Golan Heights neighborhood between Syria and Israel; rebels offer assurances of peacekeepers' well-being and appear to back away from threats to hold them as hostages, claiming that they acted to protect peacekeeping unit from Syrian government assault.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and HANIA MOURTADA
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell reported from London, and Hania Mourtada from Beirut, Lebanon. Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: It was not clear when 21 Filipino captives, seized on Wednesday in the Golan Heights, might be set free, but the authorities in Manila said they had not been harmed.

headline.seo: U.N. Starts Talks to Free Peacekeepers Held by Syrian Rebels
headline.main: U.N. Starts Talks to Free Peacekeepers Held by Syria Rebels
headline.print_headline: U.N. Negotiates to Free Troops Held by Syrian Rebels
